section.name: Tests about proportions
section.page: This diagram performs a simulation to find the p-value for testing a proportion, then evaluates the exact p-value using a binomial distribution.
This diagram shows the binomial distn for the number of successes (under H<sub>0</sub>). A slider adjusts the observed number of successes and shows the resulting p-value.

This diagram also shows the binomial distn for the number of successes (under H<sub>0</sub>). The slider for the number of successes highlights the smaller tail area and doubles this to give the p-value.

This diagram uses a simulation to find the p-value for testing a proportion. The simulated distribution can be replaced by a normal approximation to the theoretical binomial distribution and can be used to obtain the p-value for a test.
